comment: Buttery,heavy vanilla and smoke soo sweeet
Strong taste at first with a lingering aftertaste that really fades well.  Almost an earthy bitter chocolate taste that hits hard, but settles in smooth.  Acquired taste.

*actually 7yr
Barrel H170925 Bottle 133/153
128.3 proof
Diluted to ~100 proof (added 1/4 oz water per 1 oz whiskey)

Nose: chlorophyll?, ethanol, minerals (from added tap water, mineral notes removed by using distilled water instead)
Taste: warm body, anise, buttery texture
I had a bottle of this last year.  Again, a sucker for good marketing.
Rich, smooth, leather, licorice, slight tar, excellent
Comes on strong at first, has the Carmel taste Bib Tucker normally does with a oak taste. Not for the beginner palette
Very unique chocolate flavor, sweet & rich.  One of my favorites.
Make sure to add some ice or water. An excellent bourbon but it runs hot.
